str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To take up, raise; I pick up, take on board; I carry off, lead away. From ana and lambano; to take up.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From the same as Antipas; Antipatris, a place in Palestine.
